alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:53AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rusk and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 752 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New London, or 7 miles south of Kilgore, moving south at 10 mph. Small hail was indicated by a local observation system. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Overton, New London, Turnertown, Joinerville, Concord, Laird Hill and Brachfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
